scenes.background: You are leading a project team that has just received an urgent assignment requiring a significant amount of work to be completed within a tight deadline. The team is feeling a lot of pressure, and morale is low, with some members showing signs of frustration and anxiety. One of the team members, Alex, says, 'This is impossible! We can't get this done in time.' You responded by suggesting breaking the tasks into smaller parts. The team seemed somewhat relieved but still on edge. [Monica] and [Bob] exchange concerned looks. Monica then speaks up, 'Even with smaller tasks, the deadline is still too tight.' Bob, looking frustrated, adds, 'I don't think anyone here believes we can actually pull this off.' You encouraged the team to stay focused and work together, showing good self-regulation and motivational skills. Monica and Bob still seem unconvinced. Monica crosses her arms and says, 'I just don't see how this is going to work.' Bob looks at you, exasperated, 'Are we really going to keep pushing everyone this hard?' You opened the floor for suggestions but also pushed the team to continue working, showing moderate emotion perception and self-regulation. Monica sighs and says, 'I think we're setting ourselves up for failure here.' You encouraged the team to stay focused and open the floor for suggestions, showing good self-regulation and motivational skills. Monica looks stressed and says, 'I just don't know if I can do this.'
scenes.description: Bob, looking tired, adds, 'We're all feeling the weight of this. Can we really handle it?'

options.text: Let's have a quick team meeting to check in with everyone and see if we can redistribute the workload more fairly.
options.analysis: You suggested a team meeting to address concerns and redistribute work, showing high empathy and good social skills.

options.text: I know it's tough, but if we stay focused and support each other, we can get through this.
options.analysis: You encouraged the team to stay focused and support each other, showing good self-regulation and motivational skills.

options.text: I understand it's overwhelming, but we need to keep pushing forward. Let's avoid any more complaints and focus on the tasks at hand.
options.analysis: You acknowledged the team's feelings but emphasized the need to keep working, showing strong self-regulation but lacking empathy.
